metadata.title: CVE-2021-36085 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
The CIL compiler in SELinux 3.2 has a use-after-free in__cil_verify_classperms (called from __verify_map_perm_classperms andhashtab_map).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-36085` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsepol1 - 2.4-2ubuntu0.1~esm1
sepol-utils - 2.4-2ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libsepol package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4-2ubuntu0.1~esm1').
